task_summary: Robot arm picks up the red object from the table by visually localizing, approaching, grasping, and verifying stability.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a robot arm tasked with picking up a red cuboid object from a table. The robot must first detect and confirm the location of the red object among several distractors (blue ball, purple dodecahedron), safely approach it from above, align the end effector, open the gripper, lower to contact, close the gripper, and verify grasp stability. All operations are sequential, and perception gates execution. Environmental conditions like lighting and object pose may challenge perception. Recovery steps are available for initial visual failure.
preconditions: Robot arm is powered on, homed, and ready.
Red object is present on table surface.
No obstructions between gripper and red object.
stepwise_plan: Check if red object is visible.
If not visible, execute up to 3 grid-pattern scans to find the object.
Detect precise location of red object.
Move above red object with 5cm vertical offset.
Approach and align with positional tolerance (5mm).
Lower until slow contact is detected (max depth 5cm, force threshold 5N).
Verify grasp stability and red object in gripper.
success_criteria: Red object lifted off table surface.
Object stably held by gripper (no slip).
failure_and_recovery: Failure to perceive red object: retry scan up to 3 times.
Failure to grasp: abort and optionally retry sequence.
Object not in gripper or unstable: stop operation and alert.
task_long_description.termination: Ends when red object is confirmed grasped and lifted by the robot gripper, or upon reaching failure condition after allowed retries.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is currently visible to perception.
Activates a grid-pattern scan to search for the red object, up to three tries.
Detects and localizes the red object with up to 800ms timeout.
Moves end effector above red object with 5cm vertical offset.
Approaches and aligns with the red object with 5mm tolerance.
Opens the gripper to 6cm width in preparation for grasp.
Lowers gripper until slow contact is detected or max depth reached.
Closes gripper with 10N force to grasp the red object.
Confirms that the grasp is stable (no slip, adequate force).
Checks that the red object is held in the gripper after action.

failure_modes: Red object not detected in scene
Gripper fails to close or loses object
recovery_strategy: Retry grid scan if object unseen, max 3 times
Abort if unable to sense contact or grasp
Alert operator if persistent stability failure
assumptions: Red object identity inferred from visual evidence (rectangular, distinct from other colored objects)
Instruction matches observed object arrangement; no contradiction detected
Red object present and accessible for grasp
Action ports (force, timeout) snapped to lowest available compliance bins per instruction mapping

expected_success_criteria: Red object visibly lifted and held by gripper at end of sequence
